Thomas and Nanci Kuykendall wrote:

> From: Thomas and Nanci Kuykendall <tn-k4of5@...>
>
> At 06:08 PM 11/17/1999 -0800, you wrote:
> >From: David Albert <shantinik@...>
> >
> >where in idaho?
> >
> >David
>
> SE Idaho, Idaho Falls.
>
> Nanci K. in Idaho

i was hoping for northwestern, to combine with a Spokane trip -- Idaho
Falls would be about a 9 1/2 hour car trip for me, so unless I find a
way to combine with something else, it is not likely I'm afraid. Too
bad too, because I'm told that in spring that is a wonderful part of the
world!

David

messages.subject: Re: And the Skylark Sings with Me
messages.msgSnippet: ... How about Idaho?  ;-)  Isn t there someone here from SE Washington as well? I have a Brother and his family there who are vacillating about homeschooling.
messages.messageBody:
>Gee, thanks for the plug! You folks fed me, too! At any rate, I want to
>let folks know that I am available to visit with groups and give book
>talks etc. in Washington, Oregon, and southern B.C. (though in spring I
>may be going further afield.) Do contact me if at all interested.
>
>David Albert

How about Idaho? ;-) Isn't there someone here from SE Washington as well?
I have a Brother and his family there who are vacillating about
homeschooling. My SIL just quit college in her last class for her degree
in order to do what she really wants and stay home to raise her kids (girls
age 2.5 and 4.) (Hooray for Independence!! Finding freedom from
expectations and IS "teamplayer" etics!!! Hooray for being true to
yourself and your dreams!!!) Sniff, I'm so proud of her.... She was about
to get her degree to teach HS History and was profoundly unhappy, crying
herself to sleep every night and getting more depressed the closer she got
to being gone from her kids full time.

Speaking of that, do any of you work from home folks have any advice I can
pass on to my DH? He is just trying to get a MLM business off the ground
and wants to get away from his 9-5 job and back to his family. Any ideas
about types of businesses or home based jobs that are successful? Any sage
words of advice from you been there done that folks?

Nanci K. in Idaho

messages.messageBody:
megates@... wrote:

> From: megates@...
>
> I'm reading this book now and enjoying it. (And the Skylark Sings
> With
> Me) We had David come and speak with our HS support group. It was
> great! He really gave us all food for thought. I saw lots of nods of
>
> agreement with things that he said. He pointed out there is not one
> way
> or one right way to Hs, but we need to work to find what works for
> each
> child now and realize it will change in the future.
> >From one of the attendees: "It was very inspiring and just what I
> needed
> to hear".
>
> Mary Ellen

Gee, thanks for the plug! You folks fed me, too! At any rate, I want to
let folks know that I am available to visit with groups and give book
talks etc. in Washington, Oregon, and southern B.C. (though in spring I
may be going further afield.) Do contact me if at all interested.

David Albert

--

messages.subject: And the Skylark Sings with Me
messages.msgSnippet: I m reading this book now and enjoying it.  (And the Skylark Sings With Me)  We had David come and speak with our HS support group.  It was great!  He really
messages.messageBody:
I'm reading this book now and enjoying it. (And the Skylark Sings With
Me) We had David come and speak with our HS support group. It was
great! He really gave us all food for thought. I saw lots of nods of
agreement with things that he said. He pointed out there is not one way
or one right way to Hs, but we need to work to find what works for each
child now and realize it will change in the future.
From one of the attendees: "It was very inspiring and just what I needed
to hear".

Mary Ellen
If you want to do everything yourself,
insist on being the only one who can do it right.

>>>From: David Albert <shantinik@...>
My book "And the Skylark Sings with Me: Adventures in Homeschooling and
Community-Based Education" is NOW OFF THE PRESS. To read a sample
chapter, reviewers' comments, or the foreword, and for ordering info.,
visit my website at http://www.skylarksings.com>>>
